alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flood Warning for... Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 821 PM CDT, River and creek gauge reports indicated that several area creeks and streams were still rapidly rising due to heavier rainfall runoff and flash flooding earlier. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area and will continue over the next couple of hours as storm runoff continues to drain. * Area creeks and streams will likely over flow their banks potentially threatening low lying areas and roads near said creeks. This includes areas near Bassett Creek which has reached 11.81 feet and still rapidly rising. Flooding along highway 43 begins around 12 feet near the Thomasville area in Clarke county. Culverts under roads will continue to be under high stress as water slowly drains across the area and further road washouts will be possible. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Thomasville, Butler, Grove Hill, Whatley, Lisman, Coffeeville, Pennington, Fulton, Gilbertown, Toxey, Smyer, Failetown, Campbell, Woods Bluff, Cunningham, Morvin, McEntyre, Slater and West Bend.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
